intro: Schizoloma, commonly known as the African violet, is a genus of flowering plants native to Africa. These plants are characterized by their rosettes of fleshy, dark green leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers. Schizoloma species typically grow in moist, shaded environments, often in tropical and subtropical regions. The flowers are usually borne on tall stalks and are popular in horticulture for their ornamental value. They are also valued for their ability to thrive in indoor conditions with proper care.
